question: What is usually the age of diagnosis in Duchenne muscular dystrophy?
ideal_answer: The usual age of diagnosis in Duchenne muscular dystrophy is around 4.9 years.

snippets.text: The mean [median] ages in years of diagnostic milestones were: first signs, 2.7 [2.0]; first creatine kinase (CK), 4.6 [4.6]; DNA/muscle biopsy testing, 4.9 [4.8]; and time from first signs to diagnostic confirmation, 2.2 [1.4].
The mean age of diagnosis was 4.43 years.
The mean age for DMD diagnosis was 4.9 years.
In 10 cases of the group with locomotion problems (45.4%) the diagnosis was made between 3 and 11 years of age.
The mean age for DMD diagnosis was 4.9 years.
